doc.author: NetApp Ansible Team (@carchi8py) <ng-ansibleteam@netapp.com>
description: Create or destroy or modify volumes on NetApp ONTAP.
notes: The modules prefixed with na\\_ontap are built to support the ONTAP storage platform.

options.name: aggr_list
description: an array of names of aggregates to be used for FlexGroup constituents.

options.name: aggr_list_multiplier
description: The number of times to iterate over the aggregates listed with the aggr_list parameter when creating a FlexGroup.

options.name: aggregate_name
description: The name of the aggregate the flexvol should exist on.
Required when C(state=present).

options.name: atime_update
description: This is an advanced option, the default is True.
If false, prevent the update of inode access times when a file is read.
This value is useful for volumes with extremely high read traffic, since it prevents writes to the inode file for the volume from contending with reads from other files.
This field should be used carefully.
That is, use this field when you know in advance that the correct access time for inodes will not be needed for files on that volume.

options.name: auto_provision_as
description: Automatically provision a FlexGroup volume.

options.name: comment
description: Sets a comment associated with the volume.

options.name: efficiency_policy
description: Allows a storage efficiency policy to be set on volume creation.

options.name: encrypt
description: Whether or not to enable Volume Encryption.

options.name: from_name
description: Name of the existing volume to be renamed to name.

options.name: group_id
description: The UNIX group ID for the volume. The default value is 0 ('root').

options.name: hostname
description: The hostname or IP address of the ONTAP instance.

options.name: http_port
description: Override the default port (80 or 443) with this port

options.name: https
description: Enable and disable https

options.name: is_infinite
options.description: Set True if the volume is an Infinite Volume. Deleting an infinite volume is asynchronous.

options.name: is_online
description: Whether the specified volume is online, or not.

options.name: junction_path
description: Junction path of the volume.
To unmount, use junction path C('').

options.name: language
description: Language to use for Volume
Default uses SVM language
Possible values   Language
c                 POSIX
ar                Arabic
cs                Czech
da                Danish
de                German
en                English
en_us             English (US)
es                Spanish
fi                Finnish
fr                French
he                Hebrew
hr                Croatian
hu                Hungarian
it                Italian
ja                Japanese euc-j
ja_v1             Japanese euc-j
ja_jp.pck         Japanese PCK (sjis)
ja_jp.932         Japanese cp932
ja_jp.pck_v2      Japanese PCK (sjis)
ko                Korean
no                Norwegian
nl                Dutch
pl                Polish
pt                Portuguese
ro                Romanian
ru                Russian
sk                Slovak
sl                Slovenian
sv                Swedish
tr                Turkish
zh                Simplified Chinese
zh.gbk            Simplified Chinese (GBK)
zh_tw             Traditional Chinese euc-tw
zh_tw.big5        Traditional Chinese Big 5
To use UTF-8 as the NFS character set, append '.UTF-8' to the language code

options.name: name
description: The name of the volume to manage.

options.name: nvfail_enabled
description: If true, the controller performs additional work at boot and takeover times if it finds that there has been any potential data loss in the volume's constituents due to an NVRAM failure.
The volume's constituents would be put in a special state called 'in-nvfailed-state' such that protocol access is blocked.
This will cause the client applications to crash and thus prevent access to stale data.
To get out of this situation, the admin needs to manually clear the 'in-nvfailed-state' on the volume's constituents.

options.name: ontapi
description: The ontap api version to use

options.name: password
description: Password for the specified user.

options.name: percent_snapshot_space
description: Amount of space reserved for snapshot copies of the volume.

options.name: policy
description: Name of the export policy.

options.name: qos_adaptive_policy_group
description: Specifies a QoS adaptive policy group to be set on volume.

options.name: qos_policy_group
description: Specifies a QoS policy group to be set on volume.

options.name: size
description: The size of the volume in (size_unit). Required when C(state=present).

options.name: size_unit
description: The unit used to interpret the size parameter.

options.name: snapdir_access
description: This is an advanced option, the default is False.
Enable the visible '.snapshot' directory that is normally present at system internal mount points.
This value also turns on access to all other '.snapshot' directories in the volume.

options.name: snapshot_policy
description: The name of the snapshot policy.
the default policy name is 'default'.

options.name: space_guarantee
description: Space guarantee style for the volume.

options.name: space_slo
description: Specifies the space SLO type for the volume. The space SLO type is the Service Level Objective for space management for the volume.
The space SLO value is used to enforce existing volume settings so that sufficient space is set aside on the aggregate to meet the space SLO.
This parameter is not supported on Infinite Volumes.

options.name: state
description: Whether the specified volume should exist or not.

options.name: tiering_policy
description: The tiering policy that is to be associated with the volume.
This policy decides whether the blocks of a volume will be tiered to the capacity tier.
snapshot-only policy allows tiering of only the volume snapshot copies not associated with the active file system.
auto policy allows tiering of both snapshot and active file system user data to the capacity tier.
backup policy on DP volumes allows all transferred user data blocks to start in the capacity tier.
When set to none, the Volume blocks will not be tiered to the capacity tier.
If no value specified, the volume is assigned snapshot only by default.
Requires ONTAP 9.4 or later.

options.name: time_out
description: time to wait for flexGroup creation, modification, or deletion in seconds.
Error out if task is not completed in defined time.
if 0, the request is asynchronous.
default is set to 3 minutes.

options.name: type
description: The volume type, either read-write (RW) or data-protection (DP).

options.name: unix_permissions
description: Unix permission bits in octal or symbolic format.
For example, 0 is equivalent to ------------, 777 is equivalent to ---rwxrwxrwx,both formats are accepted.
The valid octal value ranges between 0 and 777 inclusive.

options.name: use_rest
description: REST API if supported by the target system for all the resources and attributes the module requires. Otherwise will revert to ZAPI.
Always -- will always use the REST API
Never -- will always use the ZAPI
Auto -- will try to use the REST Api

options.name: user_id
description: The UNIX user ID for the volume. The default value is 0 ('root').

options.name: username
description: This can be a Cluster-scoped or SVM-scoped account, depending on whether a Cluster-level or SVM-level API is required. For more information, please read the documentation U(https://mysupport.netapp.com/NOW/download/software/nmsdk/9.4/).

options.name: validate_certs
description: If set to C(no), the SSL certificates will not be validated.
This should only set to C(False) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

options.name: volume_security_style
description: The security style associated with this volume.

options.name: vserver
description: Name of the vserver to use.

options.name: vserver_dr_protection
description: Specifies the protection type for the volume in a Vserver DR setup.

options.name: wait_for_completion
description: Set this parameter to 'true' for synchronous execution during create (wait until volume status is online)
Set this parameter to 'false' for asynchronous execution
For asynchronous, execution exits as soon as the request is sent, without checking volume status

requirements: A physical or virtual clustered Data ONTAP system. The modules support Data ONTAP 9.1 and onward
Ansible 2.6
Python2 netapp-lib (2017.10.30) or later. Install using 'pip install netapp-lib'
Python3 netapp-lib (2018.11.13) or later. Install using 'pip install netapp-lib'
To enable http on the cluster you must run the following commands 'set -privilege advanced;' 'system services web modify -http-enabled true;'

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Create FlexVol
      na_ontap_volume:
        state: present
        name: ansibleVolume12
        is_infinite: False
        aggregate_name: ansible_aggr
        size: 100
        size_unit: mb
        user_id: 1001
        group_id: 2002
        space_guarantee: none
        tiering_policy: auto
        policy: default
        percent_snapshot_space: 60
        qos_policy_group: max_performance_gold
        vserver: ansibleVServer
        wait_for_completion: True
        space_slo: none
        nvfail_enabled: False
        comment: ansible created volume
        hostname: "{{ netapp_hostname }}"
        username: "{{ netapp_username }}"
        password: "{{ netapp_password }}"

    - name: Volume Delete
      na_ontap_volume:
        state: absent
        name: ansibleVolume12
        aggregate_name: ansible_aggr
        vserver: ansibleVServer
        hostname: "{{ netapp_hostname }}"
        username: "{{ netapp_username }}"
        password: "{{ netapp_password }}"

    - name: Make FlexVol offline
      na_ontap_volume:
        state: present
        name: ansibleVolume
        is_infinite: False
        is_online: False
        vserver: ansibleVServer
        hostname: "{{ netapp_hostname }}"
        username: "{{ netapp_username }}"
        password: "{{ netapp_password }}"

    - name: Create flexGroup volume manually
      na_ontap_volume:
        state: present
        name: ansibleVolume
        is_infinite: False
        aggr_list: "{{ aggr_list }}"
        aggr_list_multiplier: 2
        size: 200
        size_unit: mb
        space_guarantee: none
        policy: default
        vserver: "{{ vserver }}"
        hostname: "{{ netapp_hostname }}"
        username: "{{ netapp_username }}"
        password: "{{ netapp_password }}"
        https: False
        unix_permissions: 777
        snapshot_policy: default
        time_out: 0

    - name: Create flexGroup volume auto provsion as flex group
      na_ontap_volume:
        state: present
        name: ansibleVolume
        is_infinite: False
        auto_provision_as: flexgroup
        size: 200
        size_unit: mb
        space_guarantee: none
        policy: default
        vserver: "{{ vserver }}"
        hostname: "{{ netapp_hostname }}"
        username: "{{ netapp_username }}"
        password: "{{ netapp_password }}"
        https: False
        unix_permissions: 777
        snapshot_policy: default
        time_out: 0

    - name: Create FlexVol with QoS adaptive
      na_ontap_volume:
        state: present
        name: ansibleVolume15
        is_infinite: False
        aggregate_name: ansible_aggr
        size: 100
        size_unit: gb
        space_guarantee: none
        policy: default
        percent_snapshot_space: 10
        qos_adaptive_policy_group: extreme
        vserver: ansibleVServer
        wait_for_completion: True
        hostname: "{{ netapp_hostname }}"
        username: "{{ netapp_username }}"
        password: "{{ netapp_password }}"

    - name: Modify volume dr protection (vserver of the volume must be in a snapmirror relationship)
      na_ontap_volume:
        state: present
        name: ansibleVolume
        vserver_dr_protection: protected
        vserver: "{{ vserver }}"
        hostname: "{{ netapp_hostname }}"
        username: "{{ netapp_username }}"
        password: "{{ netapp_password }}"
        https: False

doc.author: NetApp Ansible Team (@carchi8py) <ng-ansibleteam@netapp.com>
description: Create or destroy or modify(path) cifs-share on ONTAP

options.name: hostname

options.name: share_name

options.name: username
description: This can be a Cluster-scoped or SVM-scoped account, depending on whether a Cluster-level or SVM-level API is required. For more information, please read the documentation U(https://mysupport.netapp.com/NOW/download/software/nmsdk/9.4/).

options.name: validate_certs

This should only set to C(False) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

options.name: vscan_fileop_profile

options.name: vserver

Ansible 2.6

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Create CIFS share
      na_ontap_cifs:
        state: present
        share_name: cifsShareName
        path: /
        vserver: vserverName
        share_properties: browsable,oplocks
        symlink_properties: read_only,enable
        hostname: "{{ netapp_hostname }}"
        username: "{{ netapp_username }}"
        password: "{{ netapp_password }}"
    - name: Delete CIFS share
      na_ontap_cifs:
        state: absent
        share_name: cifsShareName
        vserver: vserverName
        hostname: "{{ netapp_hostname }}"
        username: "{{ netapp_username }}"
        password: "{{ netapp_password }}"
    - name: Modify path CIFS share
      na_ontap_cifs:
        state: present
        share_name: pb_test
        vserver: vserverName
        path: /
        share_properties: show_previous_versions
        symlink_properties: disable
        vscan_fileop_profile: no_scan
        hostname: "{{ netapp_hostname }}"
        username: "{{ netapp_username }}"
        password: "{{ netapp_password }}"

doc.author: NetApp Ansible Team (@carchi8py) <ng-ansibleteam@netapp.com>
description: Create, delete, modify DNS servers.
With REST, the module is currently limited to data vservers for delete or modify operations.
notes: The modules prefixed with na\\_ontap are built to support the ONTAP storage platform.

options.name: domains
description: List of DNS domains such as 'sales.bar.com'. The first domain is the one that the Vserver belongs to.

options.name: hostname
description: The hostname or IP address of the ONTAP instance.

options.name: http_port
description: Override the default port (80 or 443) with this port

options.name: https
description: Enable and disable https

options.name: nameservers
description: List of IPv4 addresses of name servers such as '123.123.123.123'.

options.name: ontapi
description: The ontap api version to use

options.name: password
description: Password for the specified user.

options.name: skip_validation
description: By default, all nameservers are checked to validate they are available to resolve.
If you DNS servers are not yet installed or momentarily not available, you can set this option to 'true'
to bypass the check for all servers specified in nameservers field.

options.name: state
description: Whether the DNS servers should be enabled for the given vserver.

options.name: use_rest
description: REST API if supported by the target system for all the resources and attributes the module requires. Otherwise will revert to ZAPI.
Always -- will always use the REST API
Never -- will always use the ZAPI
Auto -- will try to use the REST Api

options.name: username
description: This can be a Cluster-scoped or SVM-scoped account, depending on whether a Cluster-level or SVM-level API is required. For more information, please read the documentation U(https://mysupport.netapp.com/NOW/download/software/nmsdk/9.4/).

options.name: validate_certs
description: If set to C(no), the SSL certificates will not be validated.
This should only set to C(False) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

options.name: vserver
description: The name of the vserver to use.

requirements: A physical or virtual clustered Data ONTAP system. The modules support Data ONTAP 9.1 and onward
Ansible 2.6
Python2 netapp-lib (2017.10.30) or later. Install using 'pip install netapp-lib'
Python3 netapp-lib (2018.11.13) or later. Install using 'pip install netapp-lib'
To enable http on the cluster you must run the following commands 'set -privilege advanced;' 'system services web modify -http-enabled true;'
doc.short_description: NetApp ONTAP Create, delete, modify DNS servers.

doc_strings.examples:
- name: create DNS
      na_ontap_dns:
        state: present
        hostname: "{{hostname}}"
        username: "{{username}}"
        password: "{{password}}"
        vserver:  "{{vservername}}"
        domains: sales.bar.com
        nameservers: 10.193.0.250,10.192.0.250
        skip_validation: true

doc.author: NetApp Ansible Team (@carchi8py) <ng-ansibleteam@netapp.com>
description: Configure on demand task for Vscan
notes: The modules prefixed with na\\_ontap are built to support the ONTAP storage platform.

options.name: cross_junction
description: Specifies whether the On-Demand task is allowed to cross volume junctions

options.name: directory_recursion
description: Specifies whether the On-Demand task is allowed to recursively scan through sub-directories.

options.name: file_ext_to_exclude
description: File-Extensions for which scanning must not be performed.
File whose extension matches with both inclusion and exclusion list is not considered for scanning.

options.name: file_ext_to_include
description: File extensions for which scanning is considered.
The default value is '*', which means that all files are considered for scanning except those which are excluded from scanning.
File whose extension matches with both inclusion and exclusion list is not considered for scanning.

options.name: hostname
description: The hostname or IP address of the ONTAP instance.

options.name: http_port
description: Override the default port (80 or 443) with this port

options.name: https
description: Enable and disable https

options.name: max_file_size
description: Max file-size (in bytes) allowed for scanning. The default value of 10737418240 (10GB) is taken if not provided at the time of creating a task.

options.name: ontapi
description: The ontap api version to use

options.name: password
description: Password for the specified user.

options.name: paths_to_exclude
description: File-paths for which scanning must not be performed.

options.name: report_directory
description: Path from the vserver root where task report is created. The path must be a directory and provided in unix-format from the root of the Vserver.
Example /vol1/on-demand-reports.

options.name: report_log_level
description: Log level for the On-Demand report.

options.name: request_timeout
description: Total request-service time-limit in seconds. If the virus-scanner does not respond within the provided time, scan will be timedout.

options.name: scan_files_with_no_ext
description: Specifies whether files without any extension are considered for scanning or not.

options.name: scan_paths
description: List of paths that need to be scanned. The path must be provided in unix-format and from the root of the Vserver.
Example /vol1/large_files.

options.name: scan_priority
description: Priority of the On-Demand scan requests generated by this task.

options.name: schedule
description: Schedule of the task. The task will be run as per the schedule.
For running the task immediately, vscan-on-demand-task-run api must be used after creating a task.

options.name: state
description: Whether a Vscan on demand task is present or not

options.name: task_name
description: Name of the task.

options.name: use_rest
description: REST API if supported by the target system for all the resources and attributes the module requires. Otherwise will revert to ZAPI.
Always -- will always use the REST API
Never -- will always use the ZAPI
Auto -- will try to use the REST Api

options.name: username
description: This can be a Cluster-scoped or SVM-scoped account, depending on whether a Cluster-level or SVM-level API is required. For more information, please read the documentation U(https://mysupport.netapp.com/NOW/download/software/nmsdk/9.4/).

options.name: validate_certs
description: If set to C(no), the SSL certificates will not be validated.
This should only set to C(False) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

options.name: vserver
description: the name of the data vserver to use.

requirements: A physical or virtual clustered Data ONTAP system. The modules support Data ONTAP 9.1 and onward
Ansible 2.6
Python2 netapp-lib (2017.10.30) or later. Install using 'pip install netapp-lib'
Python3 netapp-lib (2018.11.13) or later. Install using 'pip install netapp-lib'
To enable http on the cluster you must run the following commands 'set -privilege advanced;' 'system services web modify -http-enabled true;'
doc.short_description: NetApp ONTAP Vscan on demand task configuration.

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Create Vscan On Demand Task
      na_ontap_vscan_on_demand_task:
        state: present
        username: '{{ netapp_username }}'
        password: '{{ netapp_password }}'
        hostname: '{{ netapp_hostname }}'
        vserver: carchi-vsim2
        task_name: carchiOnDemand
        scan_paths: /
        report_directory: /
        file_ext_to_exclude: ['py', 'yml']
        max_file_size: 10737418241
        paths_to_exclude: ['/tmp', '/var']
        report_log_level: info
        request_timeout: 60

    - name: Delete Vscan On Demand Task
      na_ontap_vscan_on_demand_task:
        state: absent
        username: '{{ netapp_username }}'
        password: '{{ netapp_password }}'
        hostname: '{{ netapp_hostname }}'
        vserver: carchi-vsim2
        task_name: carchiOnDemand

doc.author: NetApp Ansible Team (@carchi8py) <ng-ansibleteam@netapp.com>
description: Modify a ONTAP service processor network
notes: The modules prefixed with na\\_ontap are built to support the ONTAP storage platform.

options.name: address_type
description: Specify address class.

options.name: dhcp
description: Specify dhcp type.

options.name: gateway_ip_address
description: Specify the gateway ip.

options.name: hostname
description: The hostname or IP address of the ONTAP instance.

options.name: http_port
description: Override the default port (80 or 443) with this port

options.name: https
description: Enable and disable https

options.name: ip_address
description: Specify the service processor ip address.

options.name: is_enabled
description: Specify whether to enable or disable the service processor network.

options.name: netmask
description: Specify the service processor netmask.

options.name: node
description: The node where the service processor network should be enabled

options.name: ontapi
description: The ontap api version to use

options.name: password
description: Password for the specified user.

options.name: prefix_length
description: Specify the service processor prefix_length.

options.name: state
description: Whether the specified service processor network should exist or not.

options.name: use_rest
description: REST API if supported by the target system for all the resources and attributes the module requires. Otherwise will revert to ZAPI.
Always -- will always use the REST API
Never -- will always use the ZAPI
Auto -- will try to use the REST Api

options.name: username
description: This can be a Cluster-scoped or SVM-scoped account, depending on whether a Cluster-level or SVM-level API is required. For more information, please read the documentation U(https://mysupport.netapp.com/NOW/download/software/nmsdk/9.4/).

options.name: validate_certs
description: If set to C(no), the SSL certificates will not be validated.
This should only set to C(False) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

options.name: wait_for_completion
description: Set this parameter to 'true' for synchronous execution (wait until SP status is successfully updated)
Set this parameter to 'false' for asynchronous execution
For asynchronous, execution exits as soon as the request is sent, without checking SP status

requirements: A physical or virtual clustered Data ONTAP system. The modules support Data ONTAP 9.1 and onward
Ansible 2.6
Python2 netapp-lib (2017.10.30) or later. Install using 'pip install netapp-lib'
Python3 netapp-lib (2018.11.13) or later. Install using 'pip install netapp-lib'
To enable http on the cluster you must run the following commands 'set -privilege advanced;' 'system services web modify -http-enabled true;'

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Modify Service Processor Network
      na_ontap_service_processor_network:
        state: present
        address_type: ipv4
        is_enabled: true
        dhcp: v4
        node: "{{ netapp_node }}"
        username: "{{ netapp_username }}"
        password: "{{ netapp_password }}"
        hostname: "{{ netapp_hostname }}"

doc.author: NetApp Ansible Team (@carchi8py) <ng-ansibleteam@netapp.com>
description: Create/Delete FlexCache volume relationships
notes: The modules prefixed with na\\_ontap are built to support the ONTAP storage platform.

options.name: aggr_list
description: List of aggregates to host target FlexCache volume.

options.name: aggr_list_multiplier
description: Aggregate list repeat count.

options.name: auto_provision_as
description: Use this parameter to automatically select existing aggregates for volume provisioning.Eg flexgroup
Note that the fastest aggregate type with at least one aggregate on each node of the cluster will be selected.

options.name: force_offline
description: Offline FlexCache volume before deleting the FlexCache relationship.
The volume will be destroyed and data can be lost.

options.name: force_unmount
description: Unmount FlexCache volume. Delete the junction path at which the volume is mounted before deleting the FlexCache relationship.

options.name: hostname
description: The hostname or IP address of the ONTAP instance.

options.name: http_port
description: Override the default port (80 or 443) with this port

options.name: https
description: Enable and disable https

options.name: junction_path
description: Junction path of the cache volume.

options.name: ontapi
description: The ontap api version to use

options.name: origin_cluster
description: Name of the origin cluster for the FlexCache.
Defaults to cluster associated with target vserver if absent.
Not used for creation.

options.name: origin_volume
description: Name of the origin volume for the FlexCache.
Required for creation.

options.name: origin_vserver
description: Name of the origin vserver for the FlexCache.
Required for creation.

options.name: password
description: Password for the specified user.

options.name: size
description: Size of cache volume.

options.name: size_unit
description: The unit used to interpret the size parameter.

options.name: state
description: Whether the specified relationship should exist or not.

options.name: time_out
description: time to wait for flexcache creation or deletion in seconds
if 0, the request is asynchronous
default is set to 3 minutes

options.name: use_rest
description: REST API if supported by the target system for all the resources and attributes the module requires. Otherwise will revert to ZAPI.
Always -- will always use the REST API
Never -- will always use the ZAPI
Auto -- will try to use the REST Api

options.name: username
description: This can be a Cluster-scoped or SVM-scoped account, depending on whether a Cluster-level or SVM-level API is required. For more information, please read the documentation U(https://mysupport.netapp.com/NOW/download/software/nmsdk/9.4/).

options.name: validate_certs
description: If set to C(no), the SSL certificates will not be validated.
This should only set to C(False) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

options.name: volume
description: Name of the target volume for the FlexCache.

options.name: vserver
description: Name of the target vserver for the FlexCache.
Note that hostname, username, password are intended for the target vserver.

requirements: A physical or virtual clustered Data ONTAP system. The modules support Data ONTAP 9.1 and onward
Ansible 2.6
Python2 netapp-lib (2017.10.30) or later. Install using 'pip install netapp-lib'
Python3 netapp-lib (2018.11.13) or later. Install using 'pip install netapp-lib'
To enable http on the cluster you must run the following commands 'set -privilege advanced;' 'system services web modify -http-enabled true;'

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Create FlexCache
      na_ontap_FlexCache:
        state: present
        origin_volume: test_src
        volume: test_dest
        origin_vserver: ansible_src
        vserver: ansible_dest
        hostname: "{{ netapp_hostname }}"
        username: "{{ netapp_username }}"
        password: "{{ netapp_password }}"

    - name: Delete FlexCache
      na_ontap_FlexCache:
        state: absent
        volume: test_dest
        vserver: ansible_dest
        hostname: "{{ netapp_hostname }}"
        username: "{{ netapp_username }}"
        password: "{{ netapp_password }}"

doc.author: NetApp Ansible Team (@carchi8py) <ng-ansibleteam@netapp.com>
description: Create/Modify/Delete efficiency policies (sis policies)
notes: The modules prefixed with na\\_ontap are built to support the ONTAP storage platform.

options.name: changelog_threshold_percent
description: Specifies the percentage at which the changelog will be processed for a threshold type of policy, tested once each hour.

options.name: comment
description: A brief description of the policy.

options.name: duration
description: The duration in hours for which the scheduled efficiency operation should run. After this time expires, the efficiency operation will be stopped even if the operation is incomplete. If '-' is specified as the duration, the efficiency operation will run till it completes. Otherwise, the duration has to be an integer greater than 0. By default, the operation runs till it completes.

options.name: enabled
description: If the value is true, the efficiency policy is active in this cluster. If the value is false this policy will not be activated by the schedulers and hence will be inactive.

options.name: hostname
description: The hostname or IP address of the ONTAP instance.

options.name: http_port
description: Override the default port (80 or 443) with this port

options.name: https
description: Enable and disable https

options.name: ontapi
description: The ontap api version to use

options.name: password
description: Password for the specified user.

options.name: policy_name
description: the name of the efficiency policy

options.name: policy_type
description: The policy type reflects the reason a volume using this policy will start processing a changelog.
(Changelog processing is identifying and eliminating duplicate blocks which were written since the changelog was last processed.)
threshold Changelog processing occurs once the changelog reaches a certain percent full.
scheduled Changelog processing will be triggered by time.

options.name: qos_policy
description: QoS policy for the efficiency operation.
background efficiency operation will run in background with minimal or no impact on data serving client operations,
best-effort efficiency operations may have some impact on data serving client operations.

options.name: schedule
description: Cron type job schedule name. When the associated policy is set on a volume, the efficiency operation will be triggered for the volume on this schedule.
These schedules can be created using the na_ontap_job_schedule module

options.name: state
description: Whether the specified efficiency policy should exist or not.

options.name: use_rest
description: REST API if supported by the target system for all the resources and attributes the module requires. Otherwise will revert to ZAPI.
Always -- will always use the REST API
Never -- will always use the ZAPI
Auto -- will try to use the REST Api

options.name: username
description: This can be a Cluster-scoped or SVM-scoped account, depending on whether a Cluster-level or SVM-level API is required. For more information, please read the documentation U(https://mysupport.netapp.com/NOW/download/software/nmsdk/9.4/).

options.name: validate_certs
description: If set to C(no), the SSL certificates will not be validated.
This should only set to C(False) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

options.name: vserver
description: Name of the vserver to use.

requirements: A physical or virtual clustered Data ONTAP system. The modules support Data ONTAP 9.1 and onward
Ansible 2.6
Python2 netapp-lib (2017.10.30) or later. Install using 'pip install netapp-lib'
Python3 netapp-lib (2018.11.13) or later. Install using 'pip install netapp-lib'
To enable http on the cluster you must run the following commands 'set -privilege advanced;' 'system services web modify -http-enabled true;'
doc.short_description: NetApp ONTAP manage efficiency policies (sis policies)

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Create threshold efficiency policy
      na_ontap_efficiency_policy:
        hostname: "{{ hostname }}"
        username: "{{ username }}"
        password: "{{ password }}"
        vserver: ansible
        state: present
        policy_name: test
        comment: This policy is for x and y
        enabled: true
        policy_type: threshold
        qos_policy: background
        changelog_threshold_percent: 20

    - name: Create efficiency Scheduled efficiency Policy
      na_ontap_efficiency_policy:
        hostname: "{{ hostname }}"
        username: "{{ username }}"
        password: "{{ password }}"
        vserver: ansible
        state: present
        policy_name: test2
        comment: This policy is for x and y
        enabled: true
        schedule: new_job_schedule
        duration: 1
        policy_type: scheduled
        qos_policy: background

doc.author: NetApp Ansible Team (@carchi8py) <ng-ansibleteam@netapp.com>
description: Create/Delete/Modify job-schedules on ONTAP
notes: The modules prefixed with na\\_ontap are built to support the ONTAP storage platform.

options.name: hostname
description: The hostname or IP address of the ONTAP instance.

options.name: http_port
description: Override the default port (80 or 443) with this port

options.name: https
description: Enable and disable https

options.name: job_days_of_month
description: The day(s) of the month when the job should be run. Job Manager cron scheduling day of month. -1 represents all days of a month from 1 to 31, and is only supported for cron schedule create and modify. Range is [-1..31]

options.name: job_days_of_week
description: The day(s) in the week when the job should be run. Job Manager cron scheduling day of week. Zero represents Sunday. -1 represents all days of a week and is only supported for cron schedule create and modify. Range is [-1..6]

options.name: job_hours
description: The hour(s) of the day when the job should be run. Job Manager cron scheduling hour. -1 represents all hours and is only supported for cron schedule create and modify. Range is [-1..23]

options.name: job_minutes
description: The minute(s) of each hour when the job should be run. Job Manager cron scheduling minute. -1 represents all minutes and is only supported for cron schedule create and modify. Range is [-1..59]

options.name: job_months
description: The month(s) when the job should be run. Job Manager cron scheduling month. -1 represents all months and is only supported for cron schedule create and modify. Range is [-1..11]

options.name: name
description: The name of the job-schedule to manage.

options.name: ontapi
description: The ontap api version to use

options.name: password
description: Password for the specified user.

options.name: state
description: Whether the specified job schedule should exist or not.

options.name: use_rest
description: REST API if supported by the target system for all the resources and attributes the module requires. Otherwise will revert to ZAPI.
Always -- will always use the REST API
Never -- will always use the ZAPI
Auto -- will try to use the REST Api

options.name: username
description: This can be a Cluster-scoped or SVM-scoped account, depending on whether a Cluster-level or SVM-level API is required. For more information, please read the documentation U(https://mysupport.netapp.com/NOW/download/software/nmsdk/9.4/).

options.name: validate_certs
description: If set to C(no), the SSL certificates will not be validated.
This should only set to C(False) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

requirements: A physical or virtual clustered Data ONTAP system. The modules support Data ONTAP 9.1 and onward
Ansible 2.6
Python2 netapp-lib (2017.10.30) or later. Install using 'pip install netapp-lib'
Python3 netapp-lib (2018.11.13) or later. Install using 'pip install netapp-lib'
To enable http on the cluster you must run the following commands 'set -privilege advanced;' 'system services web modify -http-enabled true;'

doc_strings.examples:
- name: Create Job for 11.30PM at 10th of every month
      na_ontap_job_schedule:
        state: present
        name: jobName
        job_minutes: 30
        job_hours: 23
        job_days_of_month: 10
        job_months: -1
        hostname: "{{ netapp_hostname }}"
        username: "{{ netapp_username }}"
        password: "{{ netapp_password }}"
    - name: Delete Job
      na_ontap_job_schedule:
        state: absent
        name: jobName
        hostname: "{{ netapp_hostname }}"
        username: "{{ netapp_username }}"
        password: "{{ netapp_password }}"
